instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 no keyboard (bad trackpad flex)
threads.message:
Hi
I have this board with no working keyboard.
I check only 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> and its ok, I can do SMC reset and that all.

Do You have any suggestion for it?
I don't have board view for this model.
Kindly Regards Mariusz

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 no keyboard (bad trackpad flex)
threads.message: Trackpad working? Tried a known good keyboard?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 no keyboard (bad trackpad flex)
threads.message:
Trackpad is ok.
I tried few keyboard, but without result.
I checked system profiler and don't see keyboard in.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 no keyboard (bad trackpad flex)
threads.message:
Do You have any information about different keyboard for this model (2015).
I have only 2012-2013 keyboards

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 no keyboard (bad trackpad flex)
threads.message:
Check for crap around <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/30. These chips loop back to the trackpad via i2C bus, so it could also be a bad trackpad or flat cable. My bet is TP or cable.
I do not have the BV for this one, not needed for a simple repair like this.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 no keyboard (bad trackpad flex)
threads.message:
It was flat cable from MB to Trackpad.
Thank You
Problem solved.
